intro: Poa carazensis, commonly known as the Caraz grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the high Andean regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Bolivia. This perennial grass is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect culms. Its leaves are narrow and often have a bluish-green hue, and it produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Poa carazensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas.
